page.title: 16The Decline of Services.
page.content: A glance around Frankton will show that this hamlet has seen better days. Just below the top locks can be found a private house which used to be the Lock Tavern. One lock below this used to be the site of a boat repair yard while the old chapel just round the corner is derelict. Tetchill had a village primary school until about 1950, although nothing remains of it today. This leaves it with nowhere to hold meetings. It also had a general store/off licence, but, this recently closed as a result of shoppers travelling further in search of lower prices. The local garage has also closed down. Telephone kiosks are now felt to be under threat. British Telecom are now looking at all kiosks taking less than Â£175 in cash. This applies to most of our kiosks!
